page.topic: Setting the Default Value for a Two-Slider Control
page.description: Setting the value for a two value slider

section.title: Setting the Default Value at Design Time
section.description: You can specify the default value for a two value Slider Control at design time using the "x..y" syntax. For example, a slider with a range of 0 to 100 could be initialized to 30 and 70 by putting "30..70" in for the *[ui:Default value]* property for the Slider Control:

figure.title: Setting the default value for a two value Slider Control at design time.

section.description: When you view the UX Component, the Slider Control will display the start and end values as 30 and 70:

figure.title: The Slider Control is defaulted to a start value of 30 and end value of 70.

section.title: Setting the Default Value at Run-time

description.p: A two value Slider Control's value can also be initialized dynamically. Let's assume you have a Slider Control that you have configured as a two value control with a range from 0 to 100. You may want to set the initial state dynamically when the initial values for the UX Component are computed.
